newsitem.title: UK: BSkyB to amend programme packages - paper.
newsitem.headline: BSkyB to amend programme packages - paper.

text.p: Pay television operator British Sky Broadcasting Plc is set to announce changes in the way it packages its programmes, the Independent newspaper reported.

The overhaul, likely to be unveiled early this week, means cable and satellite television viewers will be able to sign up for the Disney Channel without also having to subscribe to two film channels, the Independent said in Monday editions.

The Independent Television Commission (ITC), the watchdog which oversees commercial television in Britain, has been investigating the way BSkyB markets its channels following a complaint from cable operators that carry BSkyB programming.
The Independent said BSkyB was taking pre-emptive action before the ITC delivered its verdict.
